explosives.rationale: Not classified in UNRTDG Class: 1, though containing nitro groups.

flammable_solids.rationale: No data (by test methods of UN) available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: The grouping in connection with autoreactive is not included. Although the grouping in connection with explosibility is included, there is no data of laboratory tests and it cannot be classified. (It is not contained in the U.N. number 3221-3241, and is not the banned substances for carriage, either. Type G is presumed.)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Flash point: 470degC (ICSC (J), 2001) and non-pyrophoric at a room temperature.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no halogen. Not classified in UNRTDG Class: 5.1, though containing oxygen bonded to nitrogen.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: There is a report at dinitrobenzene of rat LD50: 5 to 60 mg/kg (ACGIH (2001)), and it was set as Category 2.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There is no data, and it cannot be classified. (As vapor pressureis low, inhalation exposure is with mist or particulate)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 from the statements of slight irritation in rabbit test (IUCLID (2000)) and skin irritation on humans (HSDB (2005)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the statement that mild in the rabbit test (IUCLID (2000), and that exposures stimulate the eyes in humans (IUCLID (2000), it was set as Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There was no mixture data. For the isomers, there was positive in vitro data, however, there was no in vivo data. Therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data and reports

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It was classified into category 2 based on the description that testicular atrophy and oligospermia associated therewith were observed in the eight weeks administration test in drinking water (IRIS (2006)), and major effects were the influence on testicular toxicity and reproduction (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (blood system); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is the description that exposure (including dermal exposure) causes methemoglobin blood, and headache, cyanosis, weakness, confusing, palpitation, nausea, vomiting, coma, etc.(ACGIH (2001), ICSC(J) (2001), HSDB (2005)), and it is classified into Category 1(blood). And there is the description about respiratory irritation (ICSC(J) (2002), HSDB (2005)), and it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (liver, blood, nervous system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the statement that liver disorders, anemia, and methemoglobinemia are occured by repeated exposure (ACGIH and (2001),ICSC (J)(2001),and HSDB (2005)), it was classified into Category 1 (liver, blood). Based on the statement that nervous systems are affected and occure visual disorder (ACGIH (2001), ICSC (J), (2001)), and that paresthesia on hand and foot by the obstacle of a peripheral nerve are occured (HSDB (2005)), it was classified into Category 1 (nervous system)

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour LC50=12.7mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (IUCLID, 2000).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3, since acute toxicity was Category 3 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=37.4 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
